page.title: 08WALROW ESTATE GENERAL
page.content: ON THE EASTERN OUTSKIRTS OF HIGHBRIDGE,THIS INDUSTRIAL ESTATE WAS PURCHASED BY THE NOW EXTINCT LOCAL COUNCIL IT THE EARLY 1950'S WHEN IT WAS NO LONGER NEEDED AS A RAILWAY MARSHALLING YARD. ROADS WERE BUILT,SERVICES WERE PROVIDED AND LAND WAS MADE AVAILABLE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF LIGHT INDUSTRY TO PROVIDE EMPLOYMENT FOR LOCAL PEOPLE NO LONGER NEEDED IN THE DECLINING RAILWAY AND FOOD PROCESSING ESTABLISHMENTS. TODAY SOME FORTY EMPLOYERS ARE WORKING ON THE SITE AND ALTHOUGH CHARGES ARE CONTINUOUS,ITS FUTURE APPEARS TO BE SECURE. THE CHIEF PROBLEM IS THAT OF HAVING A POUR ROAD BY THEM.HEAVY LORRIES STILL TRUNDLE THROUGH THE TOWN TO THE INDUSTRIAL SITE.AN ALTERNATIVE ROUTE HAS BEEN PROVIDED BUT IS NOT POPULAR.
